intro: Neopanax simplex, commonly known as the Hawaiian nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Neopanax simplex thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of Hawaii's native flora.
